column1: 134kph, good length on middle and leg, not much swing, he works this from the pads to forward square leg
136kph, full outswinger on off, driven very hard straight back at the bowler who knocked it away from his head, it was humming
137kph, good length, fourth stump line, just a hint of swing but not much, he leaves this alone
136kph, good length, edges a defensive stroke along the ground past second slip to fine third man and the fielder is quite square
136kph, good length, struck on the pad, big appeal but it was nipping back and too high, hit him above the pad, not out
good length, off stump, driven neatly straight to mid off
129kph, short outside off and he punches off the back foot past point! Great stroke to get off the mark
132kph, good length, pitching on middle and off, angling across the left hander and he leaves this on line and length
130kph, full on off, he drives straight to mid off
135kph, angled down leg, into the pad, he can't get back on it but it runs fine for a leg bye
nearly a run out! He took a step down, worked a length ball to midwicket and took off, Miller who ran out Cummins in Perth was swift again and had he hit Finch would have been out!
crunch! Full half volley and he thumps a cover-drive to the rope! He got a good stride in, didn't over hit it, placed it forward of point
good length outside off, pushed to cover
beaten! 138kph, outswinger, good length, well wide, Finch fends from the crease and misses
beaten again! Trying to drive off the back foot square, this has extra bounce and pace and flies past the edge. Quality from Steyn
138kph, good length, tight to off, he works this to forward square leg with the angle
another swing and miss! 142kph, outswinger way wide of off, he flashes a drive on the up and misses
142kph, good length outside off, he pushes from the crease to point
135kph, back a length, angled in, he defends from the crease back to the bowler

big appeal, given LBW!Head reviews. It was a full length, on off, he pushed hard at a drive, it looked to beat the inside edge. Nothing on hot spot or snicko. Hawkeye had it hitting in line and crashing into middle. Australia lose the review. Head was plumb. It just nipped back a touch off the seam. Not much, just enough.
135kph, good length from around the wicket, fourth stump line, he leaves alone
136kph, good length, off stump line, he pushes on the front foot back to the bowler with the full face
edged pushing at a good length, it runs well wide of second slip and fine of third man for a couple
full yorker length, he squeezes it out to mid on
140kph, sliding into the pads, he misses out on clipping this away, it was missing leg and there is no appeal
141kph, full on off, he pushes a nicely timed drive straight of mid on and gets a couple
141kph, good length outside off, hint of swing, he pushes from the crease to cover-point
good length slanting into off, he works this with the angle on the front foot wide of mid on for one
short on the hip, he's back and tucking this away to deep backward square for one
144kph, full into the pads and he misses out again trying to whip it away, it runs off the pad to square leg
138kph, good length seaming back he leaves and it hits him on the back thigh, too high, half an appeal from the bowler but it was going over
138kph, good length off stump, he's forward pushing hopefully on the inside half of the bat to square leg
136kph, back of a length wide of off, he tries to cut but mistimes to cover-point
short and wide and hammered past point! He doesn't miss out on these, it was a freebie wide of off and he cracked a textbook cut shot
137kph, good length, outside off, he leaves alone
141kph, full into the pads on leg stump he clips away wide of fine leg and they get a couple
square driven on the up! It wasn't a half volley, but well wide and he stands up and drives on the up hard through point
full down leg side, it runs fine off the pad and it races away to the rope for leg byes!
he clips this half volley away through the leg side, not well timed but he placed it past midwicket, again Steyn missing his line and length
142kph, full into the pads, he can't get bat on it but it runs off pad behind square
fuller on off driven to mid on
good length outside off, he lets this go through to the keeper
138kph, good length, middle stump, he defends on the front foot to cover
138kph, shorter length outside off, he runs off the back foot past backward point down to wide third man
138kph, good length, climbing off a length, he fends on the front foot, it hits the sticker and runs to backward point
138kph, short and wide cut with control to wide third man and Tahir misfields to allow two
sliced in the air through the vacant gully to third man, he just lost control running it off the front foot
138kph, good length, off stump, he defends off the front foot from the inside half of the bat to forward square
131kph, back of a length, nipping into the thigh of Finch who can't work it to leg
133kph, good length outside off, he presses forward and squirts to gully and the a nice diving save prevents one
130kph, back of a length turned to forward square, Klaasen misfields there's a slight mix up and they wisely opt not to run
132kph, good length on off, he defends from the crease back down the pitch
clipped away through backward square leg! Angled into leg stump and Finch tucks this away easily, beautiful timing behind square and it runs to the short boundary
slower ball and he lofts this drive in the air through cover-point and away to the rope!
on off stump, defended
lovely stroke, full at middle and off, Marsh gets forward and drives straight of mid-off
short of a length outside off, angled down to third man
round the wicket, good delivery, full outside off, draws an outside edge but goes well wide of second slip
and now he drives on the up, gets forward outside off, threads it through the covers
pulls the length back, on off stump, defended
angled into the pad, clipped through square leg...actually no bat involved
a shorter delivery, pulled out to deep square
back of a length outside off from round the wicket, left alone
back-cuts down to third man, angled wide of backward point, to bring up the fifty stand
another short ball and that's a powerful front-foot pull through midwicket
round the wicket, back of a length, gets inside the line and tucks into midwicket
full at off stump, blocked on the front foot and a sharp single is stolen into midwicket
nips of shape back in on a good length, defended to the off side
shorter outside off, opens the face and seers down to third man
tight to off stump, dropped down by his feet into the off side...looked for the single but it's not on

big edge, caught behind! Just as it as looking good for Australia, Marsh goes for a drive on the up, the delivery was back of a length, and gets a thick top edge. Hint of movement off the seam as well
goes for the yorker first ball! Not far away, Lynn just gets it on the full and jabs off the toe end
full and straight, Finch misses as he flicks across the line but the ball is angling down leg
big appeal for lbw from de Kock, Steyn not that interested, as Finch is again working across the line. The ball didn't straighten a little, but missing leg
on off stump, defended square towards point
steered down to third man
back of a length outside off, driven back to the bowler
good delivery, full at off stump, hint of swing and defended to mid-off
short outside off, dabbed into backward point
fuller outside off, nicely onto the front foot and drives between cover and mid-off
and again, very similar shot through the same spot, between cover and mid-off. Was in the air for a little while
back of a length outside off, left alone
straighter delivery, back of a length, worked into the leg side
back of a length on off stump, defended back down the pitch
starts with a wide delivery outside off, chopped off the bottom edge towards point

huge appeal for lbw and they go for the review...South Africa convinced this is pad first. Good length outside off stump, nips back, and certainly pad first. Around the knee roll. This is close. Umpire's call on impact, by a millimetre or two. He's lucky
terrific response from Finch as he drills a full delivery straight down the ground
full and straight, plays across his front pad and works out to deep midwicket
full at the stumps, pushed to mid-off
good length, defended to the bowler
tries for the yorker, becomes a low full toss, clipped through midwicket
full outside off, gets forward and pushes to the covers
a bouncer, 142kph, and he ducks
short of a length outside off, opens the face and guides it wide of gully to third man
good shot, gets forward and punches a full delivery from outside off straight of mid-on
that's loose outside off, trying to dab down to third man and he's beaten
length ball at off stump, defended
medium pace, 125kph, at the stumps and defended to mid-on
fuller, driven firmly back to the bowler
a short ball, plays a whippy pull through midwicket, not to far from the fielder
back on a full length, pushed back down the pitch
short outside off, left alone
full and straight, tapped into midwicket
an appeal for lbw from Tahir, but Finch had come a long way down the pitch...didn't read the googly, though
driven into the off side
a fuller delivery, skids on, defended
touch shorter, driven off the back foot to cover
flicks across the front pad and works into midwicket. Tahir starts with a maiden
there's Chris Lynn! Into the stands over wide mid-on. Stand and deliver, clobbers a length ball, a cutter, miles over long-on
short of a length, hits the pitch a bit harder, played into the on side
back of a length at off stump, 122kph, punched to mid-off
fuller, at the stumps, 126kph and pushed to mid-off
fuller and pushed down the ground
angles the face and runs it down to third man
uses his feet and makes it into a low full toss which he clips to long-on
defended on the front foot to cover
touch shorter, stays in his crease and drives to long-off
a little slower through the air this time, Finch waits then opens the face towards short third man
a googly outside off, defended to the covers
full and straight, another googly, defended to the leg side
a slower ball, full at off stump, defended

dragged on, big strike. Too close for the shot, perhaps? Back of a length outside off, looking to angle it into the off side, takes a bottom edge into off stump. A bit of a cutter, too, so credit to Pretorius
round the wicket to the left hander, defended to cover
gets across to off stump and works into midwicket, wants the single but is rightly sent back
tight to off stump, good length, defended to backward point
short of a length, opens the face and angles into backward point to get off the mark
very full, clipped into midwicket
defended to the off side
good length at off stump, forward and pushes to the covers
there's his first sweep, takes it from off stump out to deep square leg
full outside off, driven to cover
touch shorter, on the back foot, driven past cover and long-off can't prevent the second
short outside off, guided to third man
back of a length, straight at 110kph, punched back to the bvowler
a sweetly-struck straight drive gets him nothing as it cannons into Pretorius' boot
full at middle and leg, this time he gets it straight down the ground
good length outside off stump, defended to point
fuller, angled into middle and leg, clips off the pad and bobbles down the leg side to de Kock
full at middle, defended
tossed up fuller, driven down to long-off
knocked away from off stump into midwicket
takes a thickish inside edge into the leg side as he gets forward
swept away from leg stump, scoots past short fine leg off the bottom edge
full outside off, driven to mid-off inside the circle
good length outside off, punchy drive to deep cover
very full outside off, picks out cover as he drives
full and straight, tucked through midwicket as he closes the face
very high, and has the legs to clear mid-off...Lynn aiming a huge shot down the ground, was a slower ball, got more height than distance but landed well clear of the fielder running back

and now a tight run! Traps this off the inside edge down by his feet, called through for the run and a direct hit would have been tight but the throw hit Lynn (who didn't change direction, so is perfectly okay)
not far from chopping this on as he tries to angle down to third man, got cramped for room
defended on the front foot into midwicket
shorter, punched back to the bowler
tossed up fuller, driven down to long-off
that's a lovely shot, inside out over extra cover, a late turn of the face to create the placement and terrific timing
goes for the sweep, it's outside off, Carey misses and gets taken on the back leg well outside off
dismissive from Lynn! Fantastic shot. A good length ball outside off, Lynn stays on leg stump, throws his hands through a lofted drive which skims over the rope
well, well, Lynn is taking it on here, this is a bit more of a heave, takes a back-of-length ball and clubs it straight of mid-on
and now square of the wicket, Rabada went a touch shorter outside off, Lynn cuts it with real power through point. Fantastic batting
short and hammered away, this is thrilling stuff from Lynn, a predictable short ball from Rabada and he crunches it through straight midwicket

caught behind, and is that a bit of a send-off from Rabada?! What action in this over. Another bouncer, shorter this time, angling over leg stump, Lynn went for the hook and it takes a glove. Perhaps a word from Rabada to Lynn. Good take from de Kock.
that's sharp, a bouncer at 141kph for Maxwell's first ball and he has to be quick to get underneath it
full outside off, driven through the covers and placed nicely for a brace
swept from outside off to deep square
full at the stumps, driven back down the pitch and Tahir will be annoyed he couldn't stop that
gets forward and drives neatly to short cover
pushed square through point
plays back to a quicker ball, pushed to the off side
good length, angled across outside off, left alone
opens the face angles a length delivery to third man
full and straight, clipped firmly to mid-on
back of a length, takes an inside edge off the pad behind square on the leg side
worked off the pads behind square down to long leg...and there's a fumble to allow a second
full outside off, left alone
full and straight, defended
an appeal for lbw as Maxwell plays the reverse sweep, the ball scuttles past the keeper
works a full delivery into midwicket
that's a wonderful stroke, down the wicket and lofted over long-off, he was in complete control of that shot. Delightful
quicker delivery, defended to cover
defended to the off side
full at off stump, pushed to deep cover
round the wicket, full outside off, defended into midwicket
short outside off, Maxwell on his toes and gets over the top of the ball, square drives to deep cover
short of a length, worked off his hip through square leg
a bouncer, angling over leg stump, climbs over his head
a short ball, perhaps doesn't bounce quite as he expected, a cramped pull to deep midwicket
angled into the pads, deflects towards backward square
125kph, good length on off, pushed from the crease back to the bowler
124kph, good length middle and off, he pushes a neat drive to long on
good length, 125kph, outside off, he's forward driving past point to the man at deep cover-point
124kph, fuller on off, he drives off a thick edge that runs to a gap at forward square leg
125kph good length, off stump, he defends on the front foot to cover
126kph, good length, on off, he defends from the crease to cover
134kph, full driven nicely with the full face straight of mid on for an easy two
136kph, short not that wide, but he controls a cut perfectly past point and it races to the rope! That was so well timed from Maxwell
132kph, back of a length outside off, run with an open face off the back foot to third man
slower ball pushed way down the leg side from around the wicket
116kph slower ball, back of a length into the hip, he drops this close on the leg side and calls his partner through for one
133kph, shorter length on leg, he tucks this down to fine leg
135kph, full length, almost a yorker, squeezed out toward mid on but midwicket cuts it off
127kph back of a length angled into leg, tucked to short fine on the circle

edged and caught behind! Oh no! Just as he was looking in control, it was wide of off, not quite short enough to cut, he cut with the flashing blade, got a clear edge and de Kock took a simply catch! Maxwell admonishes himself.
125kph, back of a length, off stump, he stands tall in defence
126kph, back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot straight to cover
125kph, short into the hip, he's back and across and tucks behind square to the sweeper
126kph, bouncer, he hooks with control, rolling the wrists forward of square to the sweeper at deep square
137kph good length on middle and defended
126kph, slower ball, outside off, he reaches for it, drags it square of midwicket for one
139kph, good length, off stump, he defends from the crease
144kph, full outside off, he check drives to cover
142kph, shorter length outside off, he's back and across and playing a textbook defensive stroke
142kph full outswinger, outside off, slices a drive through the vacant gully to the wide third man
125kph, good length, top of off, he defends off the back foot

caught at midwicket! This is a howling shot! From a length on off, out of nowhere he tried to launch this over mid on, dragged it off the inside half of the bat to midwicket and Hendricks held on to a superb catch above his head! It flew sharply and he clung on with one hand.
good length, off stump, he defends off the back foot
123kph, angled into the hip, he tucks this away down to fine leg
good length angled in from around the wicket, catches the inside edge onto pad
127kph, shorter length, angled into the stumps, he turns this with the angle behind square, they push for two but it's only one
good length, middle and leg, he defends to midwicket on the front foot
142kph, inswinger to the left hander, he drives nicely but straight to mid off
143kph, full outside off, he drives to deep cover-point
144kph full outswinger, he drives off a thick edge along the ground to third man
145kph, edgeda drive off the bottom of the bat, bounces short of de Kock and he can't stop it, it runs away to fine third man
142kph, full outside off, he tries to drive but chops it back into the pitch
128kph, good length on off, he edges with an open blade along the ground to third man
126kph short outside off, he is on the back foot knocking this away to backward point
124kph back of a length, he runs this off the back foot to third man with control
126kph, good length off stump, defended to cover
128kph, full and straight, almost squeezes through, he jams off the inside edge onto pad
126kph good length, tailing into off, he opens the face and runs it to backward point
142kph, good length on off, he mistimes a drive dragging to midwicket
140kph, good length on off, he's forward running this with an open face to third man with the angled

Bowled him at 145kph! Just a missile targeting off stump, it was cross seam, Cummins was a week late as it skidded through under the probing bat and crashed into off stump! Simply too quick from Steyn
145kph, back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot to deep cover-point
144kph inswinger on off stump, he pushes on the front foot, slicing it to backward point
142kph, good length, on off, he defends on the front foot to point
run out chance and Steyn missed! Pushed straight to Steyn ay cover-point and ran but the quick fired at the non strikers and missed
turned straight to midwicket on the front foot
pushed through, 92kph, he defends on the front foot to cover
slower leg break outside of, he reaches out and defends into the leg side
tossed up, yorker length, he drives but squeezes it back to the bowler
control sweep with the spin, hit firmly to deep midwicket for a single
139kph, back of a length off stump line, he leans back an runs it off the face with a late cut to third man
cracking square drive through point! This was full and wide and hammered on the front foot past point at the sweeper on the fence has no chance
good length middle stump, defended into the leg side
good length off stump, driven expansively and with power but straight to mid off

caught and bowled! Back of a length, he was cramped for room trying to turn this around behind square, closed the face too soon, got a leading edge and it lobbed up in the air straight back to the bowler who gleefully to an easy catch
146kph, angled into middle and leg, he gets in behind it and pushes it to mid on
full outside off, he sweeps along the ground to deep midwicket
wrong un first up, he picks it and defends on the front foot to cover
93kph pushed through straight, defended to midwicket
wrong un, pitching outside off on a length, he drives extravagantly to cover
tickled down the leg side but de Kock couldn't catch it and it runs away. Barely a chance it deflected quite a way
tossed up leg break, he drives easily to long off who has gone back to allow Zampa to retain the strike
145kph, short bumper outside off, he sways underneath it and lets go by to the keeper
144kph shorter length and he pulls it well along the ground through forward square to the sweeper
137kph, full and wide, he drives hard straight to deep cover-point
144kph, good length on off, he stays leg side and knocks it away to third man
140kph, full outside off, he square drives off balance a touch, but gets it to deep point
140kph, short ball, tries to pull and is hit in the midsection! It doesn't affect him though. He rehearses the shot after missing out
wrong un outside off, driven to backward point
slog sweeps straight of deep midwicket and it goes one bounce over the rope! Great shot
wrong un, bounces a touch, he knocks it close on the off side and pinches one
wrong un, slog swept in the air to deep midwicket and Steyn runs around to cut it off
shorter on leg, he tucks this straight to midwicket
driven inside out past cover and beats the man on the rope! That is a shot of the highest class against the turn, beating deep point who didn't have to run that far.
134kph, good length off stump, he drives uppishly to deep cover-point
caught behind! Well bowled from Rabada. Shorter length, cross seam again, got a bit of extra bounce, he tried to run it to third man, got a thin edge through to de Kock and he takes the easy catch
132kph, short ball, he leans back and upper cuts through the vacant gully to third man
132kph, shorter length, he backs away and punches to point, Markram makes a diving stop
138kph, full he drives, chipping this high over mid off, just out of reach of du Plessis running back
130kph, short bouncer, he sways under it and falls over backwards but gets out of the way as it flies through
131kph, short ball off stump line, he defends into the off side off the back foot
short ball crunched to deep point and Steyn lets it go through his legs for four! It was a strong cut shot but he didn't get behind it and it went through his hands!
short ball outside off, he mistimes into the off side, takes off, is sent back, the shy at the stumps misses and there is no one backing up, they get an overthrow
lofted up and over cover! A bit of width, he clears the front leg and nails this over cover, good stroke and it races away
flicked behind square! Brilliant from Zampa. Angled into leg stump and he whips this aggressively behind square and it flies to the rope
cut up and over backward point, it flies into the outfield and is saved just next to the rope by Klaasen, he doesn't touch the rope, they get three
109kph slower ball, pushed through cover and it goes out to the sweeper
136kph yorker angled wide of off, he misses it and it flies through to de Kock
beaten, 137kph, across him, he pushes and misses, it flies through
131kph, bouncer, he sways back to try and upper cut but misses again and it flies to the keeper
137kph, full on off, he pushes on the front foot to cover
short ball, chest high, the tall man sways inside the line and lets it go
135kph, cracked off the back foot hard and straight of the sweeper at deep cover and they get a couple
136kph yorker, well dug out and it squeezes past backward point
full into leg stump, he flicks this up and over midwicket, nice stroke into the outfield for a couple
upper cut to third man, it nearly carries to Tahir but he pulls out and lets it bounce just short! He could have dived at least.
wide full toss outside off, he steps across and misses it, Zampa is frustrated
120kph slower ball, wide of off, outside the wide line, but Zampa stepped outside off to get to it, and missed. No wide call and rightly so given Zampa moved across
full toss, at off stump, he squirts this to backward point
135kph, short into the hip, he tucks this behind square

caught at midwicket! What a bizarre dismissal. It was a short ball at the body, he backed away and it followed him, he played a swat, tennis smash type shot and popped it straight up to midwicket. Easy catch for Miller.
good length, straight with a touch of swing, pushed into the leg side and nearly confusion over the wicket
back of a length at off stump, 147kph, defended towards point
full, speared down the leg side, South Africa off the mark with a wide
another one down the leg side, good pace at 149kph, trying for the leg-stump yorker
oh dear, Josh Hazlewood! Short of a length outside off, de Kock angles it down to third man where Hazlewood goes down one-handed and makes an awful mess of it
full, too straight, clipped wide of mid-on with a flick of wrists
full, wide outside off, left alone
length ball at middle and leg, clipped off the pads to midwicket
good length at off stump, defended to cover
full at middle and off, 137kph, defended into midwicket
that's a good one, full outside off, swings away to beat Hendricks' outside edge...Carey can't take it cleanly as it kept moving, like you often see in England
length ball, worked into midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched into the covers
was a good over until then, but this is short and wide, Hendricks doesn't miss out with a crunching square cut
full outside off, some late swing, pushed firmly into the covers from the front foot
gets too straight, into the pads, worked to long leg
big appeal for lbw, a ripping inswining yorker, Hendricks just manages to keep it out. They don't review, and wisely too as it's comfortably missing leg
a short ball, de Kock goes deep in the crease and nudges into square leg
full at the stumps, Hendricks hanging a touch leg side, this takes a leading edge into the covers
this zips off the surface, 152kph, back of a length outside off, left alone and Carey takes it above his head
back of a length at off stump, defended down by his feet and it bounces backwards
touch fuller, at middle and off, closes the face and works into square leg
good length outside off, defended to cover
nice delivery, back of a length outside off, hint of movement in as it's left alone
a short ball, he goes after it with a pull that is in the air, bit more top edge than middle, but easily clears the infield
good length at off stump, 134kph, defended

picks out long leg! Starc strikes early, probably not how he planned. It's a length ball shaping into de Kock, he whipped it with his strong wrists, but never tried to keep it down and Zampa judged the catch well. Didn't go in entirely cleanly, but held on. Picked out the one man in the deep, a bit careless really
good length, angled across outside off, left alone
wider outside off, through to the keeper
goes for the fuller one, outside off, jabbed to the on side
edged, just wide of second slip! An uncertain prod outside off at a back-of-a-length delivery, healthy outside edge but Finch can't get there with a dive. Would have gone to third slip
full outside off, left alone...encouraging signs for Starc
that's a top shot, meets a full delivery with the full face and punches straight down the ground
length ball pushed into the pads, worked into midwicket and just far enough from the fielder for a single
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
short of a length outside off, compactly played off the back foot
fuller, outside off, doesn't get much timing in the drive
full outside off, allows this one through to the keeper
pushed across wide outside off, left alone
closer to off stump, full, driven into the covers
a well-directed short ball outside off, 148ph, he drops his hands and sways out of the line
back of a length at off stump, 151kph, good heat from Starc, defended to cover
take that! That's one way to deal with Starc thunderbolts, this is fuller outside off, Markram picks it up off the front foot and deposits it over deep midwicket. Astonishing shot
no surprise that Starc follows it with a bouncer, Markram ducks and Starc manages a smile
full at the stumps, defended to midwicket
back of a length, gets inside the line and works into the leg side
full at off stump, 138kph, defended to cover
tucked from off stump into the leg side
gets on the pads this time, clipped behind square and the man in the deep is very wide
well bowled, back of a length outside off, squares him up a touch and takes a thick outside edge to third man
a little too straight, nicely timed off his pads and it runs behind square...fine leg is inside the circle
back of a length outside off, punched into the covers
on off stump, tucked into midwicket
good-looking shot, the back foot drive pings off the middle, but finds cover
short of a length, neatly inside the line and flicks it off his hip to deep square
back of a length at off stump, 137kph, defended to the bowler

he's been run out coming back for a third! What an error from South Africa. Length delivery, clipped off the pads through midwicket, it was a comfortable two and they pushed for the third. Markram didn't seem to be putting in the hard yards, then brought out the dive but it couldn't save him. Bat may just have been over the line, but it had never been grounded in the process. Something from nothing for Australia. Stoinis was the chaser, terrific take at the stumps by Carey
full at off stump, the captain defends his first ball to the off side
back of a length outside off, left alone
defended on the back foot to the bowler
well bowled, good length at middle and off, defended
short of a length, on the pads, worked through square leg
outside edge, caught behind! Australia are right in this now. In the channel outside off, a rather tentative push by Hendricks and it's a thin nick to Carey. They check for the no-ball, but he's okay
length ball outside off, nips back and defended to cover
at off stump, 136kph, defended on the walk
gets forward to a fuller delivery and drives behind square down to third man
full outside off, defended
full outside off, left alone. Good over from Hazlewood
low full toss, 138kph, bunted back to the bowler
comes forward and angles a length delivery down to third man
good shot by the captain, brings the bottom hand into play to take this from outside off straight of mid-on
back of a length outside off, feet stuck in the crease and the ball squirts off a thick inside edge through the leg side
short of a length on off stump, defended
back of a length outside off, left alone
starts with a big drag down, Klaasen is on the pull an places it wide of deep square
another short one, this one is hit much better, taken through straight midwicket with power. Not a good start from Zampa
gets this on a better length, defended
touch short, outside off, cut to deep cover
driven to the left of the bowler who can't cut it off
tossed up fuller, driven down the ground to long-off. Expensive start for the leggie
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
full at the stumps, another one played towards mid-off
a shorter delivery, angled into the hip, takes his bottom hand off the bat as he flicks it away
a shorter delivery angling down the leg side, du Plessis gets over a pull and finds long leg
back of a length, straight, defended to the on side
139kph, short of a length, defended into midwicket
short of a length, nudged into midwicket
banged in back of a length, defended on his toes
on his toes and punches off the back foot to the left of mid-off
short ball, pulled straight to midwicket! A day of loose batting continues and Stoinis does it. Banged in half way down, Klaasen went for the pull and couldn't keep it down. Neat, low catch by Lynn
back of a length at off stump, defended to cover
touch shorter, gets across to off stump and works back to the bowler
back of a length, played into midwicket
on off stump, 137kph, defended back to the bowler
a shorter delivery at the ribs, knocked down into the square-leg area
over the wicket, full outside off, defended to mid-off
same spot, Miller walks into his defensive shot
gets across inside the line and works off the hip behind square
full and straight, whipped off the stumps behind square
back of a length at off stump, jabbed towards point
gets away with this, full and wide, du Plessis reaches out a long way to drive and gets a bottom edge back past his stumps
full at the stumps, squeezed wide of mid-on with a closed bat face
that's a wayward one, pushed well down the leg side
full at off stump, pushed towards cover who allows it through for a freebie
length ball at the stumps, pushed to mid-on
128kph, good length outside off, he's forward and defending solidly to cover
shorter length outside off, he plays an unusual stroke, he watches into onto the blade and runs it to third man from an awkward position
131kph, good length, nipping back a touch, he stands up and punches to mid off
128kph, short ball outside off, he's pulls but gets a thick bottom edge onto his thigh
nudges this to mid on and takes off for a tight one, Finch fires, Faf dives, Finch misses but Faf was well home
bouncer, well directed, he ducks underneath it
glorious cover drive! It was 147kph full outside off and he leaned into a superb drive on the up past cover and wide of mid off. Superb stroke
125kph slower ball, on off, he defends on the front foot to mid off
cracking pull shot! This was a short ball at chest high and Faf jumped all over it, got in a great position and smoked a pull shot forward of square
another short ball, he pulls again but checks the shot with control and rolls it around to the sweeper behind square
147kph, into hip, he's jumping back and knocking this towards the square leg umpire and they pinch two. Super running
150kph but sprayed down the legside
147kph full toss tailing into leg, he clips this very fine, Cummins has to slide to save it at fine leg as they get a couple again
128kph back of a length outside off, he waits an pushes this away through backward point for one
128kph good length outside off, he defends with soft hands away to point
full and driven hard to the right of mid off and Finch makes an outstanding one handed diving save to prevent four
131kph, angled into leg stump, clipped easily to deep backward square
he shuffles down the track, its 134kph, he jams it between bat and pad and it rolls away
short ball, he spots it early and sways under it
tossed up on off, he defends on the front foot
short drag down and he hammers a pull over midwicket! Another short ball punished. Zampa struggling to find his length
drifting down leg and he clips it past short fine leg on the front foot with control for a couple
nice drifting leg break, full driven back past the bowler, he gets a hand on it but it flies away to long off
leg break on middle, tucked straight to midwicket
shorter leg break on leg stump, turned off the back foot through square leg
130kph, full outside off, driven very nicely out to deep cover
125kph, pushed down the leg side
leg stump line, clipped easily to deep midwicket
132kph back of a length, middle stump line he's back and working this to deep square leg
134kph good length, on off, driven back to the bowler
135kph, good length, top of off, he pushes to mid on from the crease
132kph, good length, off stump, knocks it down to gully and they run a single, Miller has to stretch but he beats the shy from Maxwell
tossed up, outside off, he's driven hard to cover but can't beat the man
shorter length, on middle, punched off the back foot to long on
full toss on leg, he drives along the ground to long on
95kph, pushed through on leg, he's back and tucked easily to deep square
tossed up outside off, he stretches out and pushes through point for one
tossed up outside off, very full, driven hard to deep cover-point
131kph, outswinger wide of off, pushed on the front foot to the man in the deep at point
135kph, good length outside off, he's forward but leaving this well wide of off
good length off stump, he's cramped defending on the front foot
short and wide and he cuts up and over point! A mistake given the field. He was trying to build pressure and dished up a freebie, Miller lifted the cut up and over the ring
good bumper, much tighter to off, he drops the hands underneath it and lets it go
137kph, good length but angled in and he tucks this from off, with the angle to the gap between fine leg and deep square and they run well
138kph, back of a length, wide of off, cut hard on the bounce but Maxwell makes an excellent one handed stop to save four
good length, tighter to off, he props forward, waits and runs it off the angled blade to third man
full on middle, he clips to mid on and takes a run, Head gathers and shies but Miller just beats the throw which misses at any rate
good length 137kph, outside off, he drives well on the rise forward of the point sweeper for an easy two
short at the body, he swivels so quickly and pulls along the ground with control to deep backward square
138kph, short ball across him, he drops the hands and sways underneath it
136kph good length, off stump, he defends solidly on the front foot
shorter length into the hip, he tucks this to square leg
136kph bouncer, well directed but again he ducks under easily
135kph, back of a length outside off, he defends with his hands away from his body to point
137kph bouncer again, even higher and outside off, he sways under it
139kph off stump, good length, he tries to turn to leg but can't get it past forward square
top edge trying to pull but it flies high and safe way over the keepers head and down near the rope. It got a bit big on him that short ball. They got an easy two
beaten outside off. Good length outside off, just nibbled away a touch, he tried to drive inside out but missed
140kph, fuller and closer to off, he defends on the front foot into the off side
short ball pulled brilliantly behind square and the man on the fence at deep square, Starc, had to make a superb diving save to prevent four
131kph half-volley but he mistimes the drive to mid off
136kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot into the off side
shorter length, pitching outside leg, taking him on the thigh and rolling away
shorter length, middle stump, he tucks off the back foot around the corner to fine leg
back of a length, top of off, he defends from the crease into the leg side
142kph, shorter length outside off, he's jumping back and across and defending to point
140kph, good length, top of middle, he defends again to midwicket
137kph, short bouncer, he shaped to pull but bailed out, it was way too high and duly called wide
139kph, good length, well wide of off, he leaves this alone
back of a length outside off, 138kph, he's back and forcing through cover-point to the sweeper
142kph, good length, fourth stump, defends with very soft hands under his eyes to backward point
137kph good length on leg stump, turns this easily behind square to the sweeper
141kph good length outside off, he runs this off the front foot to third man
139kph short ball, he cracks a pull shot hard on the bounce to deep square
146kph, short down the leg side, he ducks and it's called a wide, Hazlewood not happy
146kph way down leg, no arguments there
supreme cover drive! This was full outside off and he plays a glorious drive, places it perfectly past cover and it races away to the rope
pushed way down leg again, another extra
138kph, good length, fifth stump line, he defends away from his body

chopped on! There's the breakthrough! This was back of a length and well wide, du Plessis threw the hands at it from the crease with an angled back, got a thick inside edge and dragged it back onto the stumps! A touch unlucky for the South Africa captain but Australia will take it
good length, off stump, he defends on the front foot
beaten outside off! Good length, nipping away, he spars at it and misses
142kph, wide of the crease, angled into off, he defends again on the front foot
138kph, speared into middle, full and he defends again back to the bowler
145kph, into leg stump, he clips this past midwicket to the man in the deep
145kph, good length on off, he defends on the front foot to cover-point
145kph driven nicely on the up wide of mid off and it beats the fielder and they get three
143kph bumper pushed down the leg side again
full inswinging yorker, huge appeal for LBW! Not out is the call. Australia don't review and wisely so. He got an inside edge and it was sliding. Ripping yorker though
another super yorker speared to off, and Miller jams down to keep it out
good length, off stump line, he plays a textbook forward defence to cover
128kph, good length, off stump, he defends on the front foot
130kph back of a length, outside off, pushed nicely past cover
129kph back of a length outside off, he runs it off the open face to third man
129kph, good length off stump line, he defends on the front foot
127kph bouncer, that balloons high over the head but not called a wide, must have been just under head height given he ducked a touch
132kph, good length off stump line, he forces from the crease to midwicket
144kph, middle and off, worked with the angle to midwicket but can't beat the man
142kph shorter outside off, he late cuts with control running it to third man
145kph, good length outside off, he pushes firmly to cover
145kph, good length well wide of off, he strides forward and lets it go
143kph, short ball, lifted from a length, he propped forward and dropped the hands to let it whiz past his chest
147kph searing yorker into off stump and he jams it out! He set the whole over up for it but the batsman read the play
advances and launches over mid on! This was great batting. He shuffled down the track, no one back on the rope, he lofted the length ball up and over and it carried all the way
good length, outside off, he defends on the front foot
sloer ball, 110kph, outside off, driven hard but straight to cover
129kph short ball outside off, he drops to a knee and sways under it
131kph another short ball, again he drops low and sways underneath
back of a length outside off, pushed off the back foot to backward point
starts with one dragged down but it's pulled to midwicket
fuller and driven to deep cover
full and straight, driven to mid-off
clipped off his toes to square leg
another short one, poor delivery, Miller has all the time in the world to rock back and place it backward of square with a pull
gets a fuller length, clipped wide of midwicket to the sweeper
short outside off, drives to deep cover
full at off stump, clipped firmly down the pitch with the bottom hand coming through
full at the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
that's a medium-pace long hop (although they can take wickets) which is pulled powerfully to deep midwicket
round the wicket, short of a length, whipped to midwicket
outside off, left alone...not a million miles from off stump
full at off stump, driven to cover
very full, he goes for the drive and it squeezes off the outside edge through short third man
full, tossed up, played out to cover
clipped through square leg
uses his feet, almost yorks himself, drives to mid-off who is inside the circle
leans forward and taps a straight delivery into the leg side...better over from Zampa, although South Africa don't need to take risks
good length at off stump, he comes forward, takes the outside edge but safely down to third man
back of a length on leg stump, tucked off the pads to deep square
a short ball which Pretorius seems to make a late decision to try and ramp over the slips, ambitious shot and doesn't make contact
pushes a back-of-a-length delivery to cover
full at the stumps, pushed firmly to cover
steered wide of point as he opens the face
excellent shot, gets forward to a full delivery and pushes it neatly straight down the ground
that's the breakthrough, Hazlewood does it! Another spliced pull, lobs to midwicket. A well-directed short ball, tight to the body, cramped Pretorius for room. Hazlewood is pumped. Game on
beaten first ball as he pushes away from his body at a back-of-a-length delivery
fuller, at off stump, drives to mid-off while taking the bottom hand off the bat
full again, driven square to point
a shorter delivery, Steyn just about stays in line as he defends on the back foot
good length at off stump, defended to cover
short of a length on the hip, deflects very fine and Carey does well to intercept with a dive. Important runs saved
that's a ripper from Cummins which climbs past Miller's outside edge
punched off the back foot to deep cover
this jumps at Steyn from back of a length, takes the splice and pops to the on side
fuller at the stumps, defended to mid-on, so that's Cummins done for the night
good length at middle and off, defended to cover
a shorter ball, 139kph, Miller jumps back in his crease and plays to the leg side
short outside off, nicely timed through point with a horizontal bat
short of a length, pushed to the off side...closing in on a run-a-ball needed
a bouncer which angles down the leg side as Steyn ducks, and it's called wide to a few boos around the ground
a flashing shot from Steyn as he throws his hands at a short, wide delivery and flays it down to third man
full outside off, good stride into the ball and drives to deep cover to take him to fifty off 68 balls. First half-century of the match
short of a length, on his toes and drives to deep cover
works a straight delivery to mid-on with a bottom-handed flick
drives on the up over the off-side ring, wide of the cover sweeper

through him! Hits the timber. Stoinis does it again. A back of a length delivery, bit of a cutter, a cross-seamer which skids on, Steyn just looking to work into the leg side, takes the toe of the bat into the stumps
length ball into the pads as Rabada tries to tuck it away
gets the yorker in, Rabada gets his bat down and works it out to deep square leg
over the wicket, very full, in the block hole. Blocked.
touch more air this time, flicked to midwicket
good length, defended on the front foot
tossed up on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
this is a low full toss which is driven down to long-off
a flatter, quicker ball skids on outside off and Miller is beaten over the top edge as he aims a square cut. Miller can't get the strike back
a short ball over off stump, left alone
round the wicket, full at the stumps, manages to get this past midwicket and wide of mid-on

huge appeal for lbw, given not out and Finch calls for the review! Miller had used his feet so he's a long way down the pitch. But it looked straight. Nothing on Snicko. And it's three reds. Hitting off stump. He's gone, and that could be the match
flayed through the covers, drives at a full delivery and beats mid-off
gives himself some and drives to room
backing away outside leg and flaps at a length ball
pads this away outside leg stump
full at the stumps, swung out to deep midwicket
drives a length delivery back to the bowler
lofted straight down the ground to long-on
plays forward and gets the outside to a googly, or maybe a slider, which runs through third man
full at the stumps, clubbed down the ground...big effort from Zampa
round the wicket, full outside off, swing and a miss
same again, full outside off, Ngidi playing at fresh air
drives and misses at a length delivery
four in a row for Starc, fuller at off stump, Ngidi drives and is beaten
goes for the yorker, it's on target but squirts off the outside edge to third man
full, angled into the pads, clipped down to long leg but just a single
length ball, Rabada slog sweeps, doesn't connect that well and it goes wide of long-on
shorter, outside off, a googly and Rabada can't connect
full outside off, heaved down the ground to long-off
is this a superb stumping?! Carey reckons so. A swing to the leg side, skids between bat and pads. Excellent take and whips the bails off...but it looks like he's just got the back foot over the line
swing and a miss outside off
tossed up, a low full toss, and it's slog-swept to deep midwicket. Does that keep South Africa just above alive?
cleaned him up with the yorker! That was on the cards. Full, straight, quick. Rabada aims a drive and he's gone
round the wicket, full and straight, driven to the off side
full, wide outside off, plays over the top of it
full at the stumps, Tahir well outside leg but manages to get the bat on it
pushes into the covers and starts wandering down the pitch, but is sent back
pushes a full delivery to the covers
drags a low full toss from outside off to deep midwicket
full outside off, Tahir swings hard through the line and sends it to long-off
heaves across the line, another good take from Carey as this bounces a bit
swings across a length ball, takes a bottom edge to short fine leg
tossed up, Tahir heaves and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
well, well...he connects over midwicket this time, given a bit of air, and it's sent into the stands
round the wicket, it's a wide full toss, carved wide of short third man and goes to third man rope
fired wide outside off, Tahir just about reaches it and jabs into the covers
full and straight, takes an inside edge past the stumps to short fine leg
wide outside off, huge swing from Tahir, he misses and it rebounds off Carey's gloves. Australia nearly home
the bat has flown miles! In fact, it has shaped the handle off, Ngidi loses his grip as he swings to the leg side
carved through the off side, it will go to the boundary but Australia have done it
